Job Description: Candidate must possess at least a Bachelor's/College Degree , Professional License (Passed Board/Bar/Professional License Exam), Geology/Geophysics or equivalent. Applicant must have basic knowledge in Hydrogeology. Applicant must be able to visualize and interpret geological and/or environmental information about ground water conditions. Applicant must be able to effectively communicate verbally, technically and in wiritten form. Applicant must be able to learn new applications and methods in hydrogeology. Knowledge in ARCGIS and mapping software is an advantage. Applicants must be willing to work in Brgy. Ususan, Taguig City. 2 Full-Time position(s) available. Job Description Conduct hydrogeological surveys and feasibility studies. Perform groundwater assessment using specialized instrumentation and equipment;maintain and regularly inspect and calibrate all equipments. Analyze samples; prepare qualitative and quantitative reports based on analysis results. Assess issues with groundwater and provide recommendations. Performed data analysis of soil and groundwater conditions for reports and models. Acquire efficient computer skills to utilize databases and maintain organized data management.

Data Analyst, Geochemistry PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES As a member of the team in our Global Business Solutions (GBS) center, this position is responsible for validation and approval of data generated from the laboratory production according to the requirements of the technical aspects of the current Quality Management System. Once the data have been finalized and approved, the Data Analyst is responsible for generating the certificates of analysis and releasing results to the clients. The Data Analyst also provides specialized technical input during pre, in-process and post stages of production where necessary and participates in the investigation for any quality non-conformances. REPORTING TO: Operational direct reporting to Affiliate Manager or Supervisor; administrative accountability to GBS Supervisor. SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES • Performs final Quality Control validation as stated on QP21 on all laboratory results by comparing results to standards and often to different laboratory schemes, initiates correction action if results are outside tolerance.• Initiates recheck requests as needed.• Identify “Over Range” as per instruction and initiate additional assay.• Prepares certificates of analysis and releases results to external and internal clients.• Assists Department Supervisor and QA/QC Supervisor to investigate and resolve any quality non-conformances.• Assists in setting up Proficiency tests, follows up on progresses and performs QC validation on results.• Ensures all requested analysis are completed by referring to sample submission forms.• Maintains QC control charts on selected laboratory schemes. • Monitors results and provides feedback to Area Supervisors.• Provides technical input to all departments as needed.• Keeps up to date on all certified reference materials being used throughout the lab.• Participates in internal audits and Quality action investigation as needed.• Maintains a clean working environment.• Follows all company health, safety and environmental policies. PROFILE• A minimum of a BSc degree (or equivalent) is required.• 3 years previous experience in laboratory and /or mineral operation is preferred.• Previous experience with ISO/IEC 17025 requirements is preferred.• Previous experience in a Quality Control related role is preferred.REQUIRED SKILLSSpecific technical skills:• Strong practical knowledge in geochemical analysis and statistical analysis is required.• Good communication skill for all upward and horizontal directions.• Full professional proficiency in English.• Ability to follow instructions.• Ability to manage several projects within widely diverse areas of expertise whilst providing technical support for completing projects as needed.• Must be able to read, understand and follow work instructions in a safe, accurate and timely manner.• Ability to compose clear and concise technical reports.• Candidates must be proficient in using various type of computer software (Word, Excel, etc.).• Proven ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects in a fast-paced, highly professional environment.• Demonstrates excellent verbal and written communication skills including grammar and composition.• Ability to work well with others & independently.• Proven time management skills and a strong attention to detail.• Works well under pressure.• Ensures full compliance with the company’s Quality Management, Health & Safety, Code of Integrity, and Professional Conduct policies.

This is a 1-year project employment based in Tampakan. The role is responsible for the conduct of land ownership validation of all covered areas to secure access for the mine facilities of the Tampakan Copper-Gold Project. Specific Personal Accountabilities: Sustainable Development Practices – Ensure effective use of the Project's safety and environmental-friendly standards and systems within own area of responsibility to positively contribute on nurturing the organization’s sustainable development culture and compliance to ISO 140001. Land Acquisition and Management – Responsible in validating the land parcels within the Phase 1 coverage. Cost Management and Accountability – Ensure prudent and judicious use of the company’s resources without compromising the delivery of quality products and output in the most effective and efficient way. Compliance – Ensure that land acquisitions within the ancestral domain is in accordance with in the FPIC rules and guidelines specifically the Memorandum of Agreement with the indigenous people (IPs). Internal Legal Support – Provide internal legal support services based on the mandate of Legal and Compliance Department. Key requirements: Bachelor’s Degree in Geodetic Engineering, preferrably with valid license Minimum of two (2 years) experience in topographic survey executing parcellary, isolation and relocation surveys. Experience working with ICCs/IPs especially the Blaan Tribe and able to walk for long hours in rugged terrain. Must possess good presentation skills, cross-cultural resourcefulness and sensitivity, political savvy and result driven work fervour. Proficient in MS Office applications

Qualifications: Excellent communication skills Basic skills in AutoCAD, GIS, GE, MS Powerpoint, Excel Trustworthy in handling confidential information Dependable in delivering assigned tasks Willing to relocate and do fieldwork Key Duties and Responsibilities: Generate General Map and the likes on assigned area tags. Generate Right of Way Maps Generate Base Maps Complete tasks in a timely manner with satisfactory results. Maintain running database for overall Landbank Maintain data repository for overall Landbank

Job Title: GIS Database Administrator (Asset Info Systems Management)
Job Description: Job Responsibilities Regulatory compliance • Prepare reports as required and recognize anomalies in reported data • Conducts data analysis and preparation of documents, data reports, and maps in compliance to the service improvement reporting guidelines of Schedule 6 of Concession Agreement and Asset Condition Reporting Guidelines • Provides KPI report to MWSS RO, Manila Bay Corporate Office as part of Supreme Court Mandamus Database management • Creation of spatially enabled database models for enterprise asset information management systems • Set-up, maintenance and running of RDBMS and spatial data as well as development of enterprise GIS for asset information management. • Administration of GIS database and integrated environments within the asset information system • License management for GIS server and all GIS users within the enterprise • Ensures that accurate and complete metadata are developed for all datasets created by GIS staff and that metadata is distributed with data when requested by outside agencies. Service delivery • Manages the overall mapping services requirement for Manila Water • Ensures delivered mapping product is in adherence to quality management systems, data privacy and information technology governance policies. • Make appropriate asset management data available for decision making Job Requirements With at least a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Engineering, GeoScience With at least 3-year work experience in relevant industry At least 5 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position. Applicants must be willing to work in MWSS Admin Bldg.,489 Katipunan Road,Balara. Preferably Supervisor / 5 Yrs & Up Experienced Employees specializing in Geology/Geophysics or equivalent. Full-Time position(s) available.

OUR CLIENT: Our client is a fast-growing B2B SaaS business, providing work management software for Telco, network engineering and construction organisations. With hundreds of billions of dollars being spent on network infrastructure projects around the world, finding new ways to maximize productivity and minimize risk has never been more critical. They improve controls of a network rollout and reduces the cost and time to deploy across the project lifecycle - with no clear competitor in the market. THE ROLE: Our client is currently seeking a recent graduate who is passionate about data management to help us in the processing of customer data from numerous sources (GIS data files, AutoCAD, PDF designs, spreadsheets) into a form usable by our applications, along with reporting activities. This role can be expanded into areas of scripting/programming and data science dependent on the aptitude and abilities of the candidate as we grow the team. Primary Responsibilities: ● Prepare input data from such sources as Geospatial data sets (e.g. ESRI Shapefiles), AutoCAD files, PDF and spreadsheets into a prescribed form manually using GIS tools (e.g. QGIS) and using in-house scripts/programs. ● Extract output data from our systems in preparation for delivery to the customer, including running preparation scripts for photos and Geospatial data sets and organising them on shared file stores. ● Perform Quality Assurance on data, preparing reports as directed. Skills and Experience: ● Bachelor level qualification in STEM ● A “can do” attitude. ● Experienced in data processing, with strong spreadsheet software skills and with database querying experience (SQL). ● Experienced to some level in GIS and CAD systems. ● Some experience in scripting/programming (e.g. using Python or R). ● Strong problem solving skills. You are a great fit for our Company Culture if you are: A driver of his/her own education, into self-improvement - reads books, listens to podcasts, subscribes to articles, with a goal in mind to create value for oneself and for others, asks for feedback from his/her head for improvement points With a curious mind Has the ability to identify problems, come up with options, and recommend the way forward Into process improvements - thinks of making processes more effective, streamlines processes, into working smarter With an Attitude of Gratitude Self-leader, a fire starter Technical requirements that will drive this role to a success: Excellent communication skills - verbal, written, and listening WFH set-up ready. Recruitment Journey: The whole process takes about 4 weeks. There will be 4 interviews and a possible technical test from our client. You will undergo an initial interview, interview with our lovely client/s, culture fit interview, and final interview. This will run for about 1 week but we will let you know if we need to ramp it up. Be yourself and have fun. We will constantly communicate with you as to the development of your application. You can also directly communicate with us to ask us about the status of your application. If all is well, we will offer you the job and require you to get the pre-hiring requirements within 5 days at the most. So preparedness is the key! Pre-hiring requirements: We would be grateful if you have these already! Fit to Work/Health Card NBI Clearance Social IDs - PHIC, SSS, HDMF, TIN

Job Description: Convert physical maps into digital formMerge various data to digitized mapsManage and improve existing GIS databaseMaintain, improve and develop mapping applicationsDevelop and improve program codes to automate data updates and analysis Job Requirements: Must be a licensed Geodetic Engineer, Civil Engineer or any related coursePreferably has a GIS certificationHighly competent, self-driven and has a passion for excellenceMust have good interpersonal and communication skillsMust be willing to be assigned in Shaw Blvd., Mandaluyong CityFresh graduates are welcome to apply

BS Geology with Professional License Newly Graduates are acceptable At least 1 to 2 years Geology related work experience is an advantage Role Purpose To assist the geologist, to oversee both exploration and mine geology field activities related to the generation, collection, analysis and interpretation of geological information for exploration target generation and to ensure quality and validity of mine geology data to improve ore geological controls and maintain economic profitability of the company. Key Duties and Responsibilities Detailed geological logging of drill core samples (DD and RC)Detailed mapping and documentation of all mine floor and wall exposuresStrict implementation of all standard operating procedures and safety and environmental policiesInvolved in the planning and implementation of all in-pit shift grade control activities – including but not limited to drilling, sampling, blast leveling, mark out, tallying and floor cleaningSupervising grade control drilling and sampling and ensure that quality is guaranteed during data collection of the grade control processInvolvement in the planning and implementation of mineral exploration programs and geophysical surveys, with general logistical and safety tasks associated with work in rural environments

EXPLORATION RESOURCE GEOLOGIST Accomplish geological modeling and mineral resource estimates Assess applicability of resource estimation parameters Perform QA/QC checks of historical and current drill hole database Identify and report information gaps within the model that requires further exploration work Timely submission of outputs Qualifications: The candidate must be a licensed Geologist or equivalent With relevant experience in gold and copper epithermal and porphyry; geostatistics and resource estimation background, preferred At least five (5) years of related work experience Willing to work in Lepanto Minesite, Mankayan, Benguet Required Skills: Proficient in the use of Gemcom & Leapfrog Software Proficient in Geostatistics Analytical Thinking Attention to Details Commendable work ethics and values integrity High ability to maintain confidential information
